name: United Kingdom
description: UK employment law balances employee protections with business flexibility through statutory rights and common law

employmentType.rule: Written statement of employment particulars must be provided from day one of employment.
employmentType.exceptions: Contract terms can be varied by mutual agreement. Zero-hours contracts permitted but with restrictions.

minimumWage.rule: National Living Wage: £11.44/hour (23+), National Minimum Wage tiers by age. Must be clearly stated.
minimumWage.exceptions: Apprentices have lower rate (£6.40). Self-employed not covered.

holiday.rule: Statutory minimum 5.6 weeks (28 days for full-time) paid annual leave including bank holidays.
holiday.exceptions: Employer can require bank holidays to be taken from entitlement. Part-time workers pro-rated.

workingHours.rule: Maximum 48 hours average per week under Working Time Regulations. Minimum 11 hours rest per day.
workingHours.exceptions: Workers can opt-out of 48-hour limit in writing. Night workers limited to 8 hours average.

overtime.rule: No statutory right to overtime pay. Terms depend on employment contract.
overtime.exceptions: Total pay averaged over period must meet minimum wage requirements.

terminationNotice.rule: Statutory minimum: 1 week after 1 month service, then 1 week per year of service up to 12 weeks maximum.
terminationNotice.exceptions: Contracts can specify longer periods. Summary dismissal permitted for gross misconduct.

unfairDismissal.rule: Employees with 2+ years service protected from unfair dismissal. Must follow fair procedure.
unfairDismissal.exceptions: Automatically unfair reasons (pregnancy, whistleblowing) protected from day one. ACAS code must be followed.

redundancyPay.rule: Statutory redundancy pay after 2 years: 0.5-1.5 weeks' pay per year of service (max £700/week, 20 years).
redundancyPay.exceptions: Enhanced redundancy may be offered contractually. Consultation required for 20+ redundancies.

sickPay.rule: Statutory Sick Pay (SSP) of £116.75/week for up to 28 weeks. Payable from 4th day of illness.
sickPay.exceptions: Many employers provide enhanced sick pay. Self-certification for first 7 days, then fit note required.

maternityPaternity.rule: 52 weeks maternity leave (39 weeks paid via SMP). 2 weeks paternity leave. Shared parental leave available.
maternityPaternity.exceptions: Qualifying conditions apply (26 weeks service). Enhanced pay common but not required.

discrimination.rule: Equality Act 2010 protects against discrimination on 9 protected characteristics from recruitment onwards.
discrimination.exceptions: Occupational requirements may justify differential treatment in limited cases.

dataPrivacy.rule: UK GDPR applies. Privacy notice required. Lawful basis needed for processing employee data.
dataPrivacy.exceptions: Special category data (health, trade union) requires additional safeguards.

nonCompete.rule: Restrictive covenants enforceable only if reasonable to protect legitimate business interests. Must be proportionate.
nonCompete.exceptions: Garden leave may be used. Courts can strike out unreasonable restrictions.
